messages.content: Where are the custom language-specific base images contributed from?
AppThreat contributes the custom language-specific base images from this repo.
What are the advantages of using custom container images?
These images include additional language-specific build tools and development libraries to enable automatic restore and build operations.
What is the container image tag for the default all-in-one cdxgen image with java?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen:master
What is the container image tag for the default all-in-one cdxgen with deno support image with java?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-deno:master
What is the container image tag for the secure all-in-one cdxgen image with java?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-secure:master
What are the container image tags for Java 11?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java11-slim:v11, ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java11:v11
What are the container image tags for Java 17?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java17-slim:v11, ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java17:v11
What is the container image tag for .Net Framework 4.6 - 4.8, .Net Core 2.1, 3.1, and .Net 6.0?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-dotnet6:v11
What is the container image tag for .Net 7?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-dotnet7:v11
What are the container image tags for .Net 8?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-dotnet8:v11, ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-dotnet8:v11
What are the container image tags for .Net 9?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-dotnet9:v11, ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-dotnet9:v11
What is the container image tag for Python 3.6?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python36:v11
What is the container image tag for Python 3.9?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python39:v11
What is the container image tag for Python 3.10?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python310:v11
What is the container image tag for Python 3.11?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python311:v11
What is the container image tag for Python 3.12?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python312:v11
What is the container image tag for Node.js 20?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-node20:v11
What are the custom image to use for Ruby 3.3.6?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-ruby33:v11
What are the custom image to use for Ruby 3.4.1?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-ruby34:v11
What are the custom image to use for Ruby 2.6.10 (debian version)?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-ruby26:v11
What are the custom image to use for Ruby 2.5.0 (SLE version)?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-ruby25:v11
What are the container image tags for Ruby 1.8.x?
ghcr.io/cyclonedx/debian-ruby18:master
How do I use the Java 11 version of cdxgen in a Docker container?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $HOME/.m2:$HOME/.m2:rw -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java11-slim:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t java
How do I target Java 8 with Java 11 Docker image?

Use the java 11 image but pass -t java8. Example: docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $HOME/.m2:$HOME/.m2 -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-java11-slim:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t java8
How do I generate a SBOM for a .Net Framework 4.6 - 4.8 application using the cdxgen container?
docker run --rm --platform=linux/amd64 -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-dotnet6:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t dotnet
How do I generate a SBOM for a Dotnet 3.1 or Dotnet 6.0 application using the cdxgen container?
docker run --rm --platform=linux/amd64 -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-dotnet6:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t dotnet
How can I use the .NET 7 container image?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-dotnet7:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t dotnet
How can I use the .NET 8 container image?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-dotnet8:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t dotnet
How can I use the debian version .NET 8 container image?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-dotnet8:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t dotnet
How can I use the .NET 9 container image?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-dotnet9:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t dotnet
How can I use the debian version .NET 9 container image?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-dotnet9:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t dotnet
How do I generate a SBOM for a Python 3.6 application using the cdxgen container?

docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python36:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t python . Note: dependency tree is unavailable with Python 3.6.
How do I generate a SBOM for a Python 3.9 application using the cdxgen container?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python39:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t python
How do I generate a SBOM for a Python 3.10 application using the cdxgen container?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python310:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t python
How do I generate a SBOM for a Python 3.11 application using the cdxgen container?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python311:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t python
How do I generate a SBOM for a Python 3.12 application using the cdxgen container?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-python312:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t python
How do I generate a SBOM for a Node.js 20 application using the cdxgen container?

docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-node20:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t js. Note Use --platform=linux/amd64 in case of npm install errors.
How do I generate a SBOM for a Ruby 3.3.6 application using the cdxgen container?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-ruby33:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t ruby
How do I generate a SBOM for a Ruby 3.4.1 application using the cdxgen container?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-ruby34:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t ruby
How do I generate a SBOM for a Ruby 2.6.0 (Debian Version) application using the cdxgen container?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-ruby26:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t ruby
How do I generate a SBOM for a Ruby 2.5.0 (SLE version) application using the cdxgen container?
docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-ruby25:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t ruby
How can I generate an SBOM and automatically install the appropriate version of Ruby, using rbenv?

Pass any Ruby version with the type argument to make cdxgen automatically install the appropriate version using rbenv prior to BOM generation. Example: Pass -t ruby3.3.1 to install Ruby 3.3.1. docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-debian-ruby34:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t ruby3.3.1.
How can I work with Ruby 1.8 applications?
We have a Ruby 1.8 image that uses debian:jessie as the base image. Unfortunately, we couldn't find a way to install nodejs >= 20 in jessie, so we need a split workflow:
What is the first step in the split workflow for Ruby 1.8?
Perform bundle install with our debian-ruby18 image: docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp:rw -e GEM_HOME=/tmp/gems -v $(pwd):/app:rw -w /app -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/debian-ruby18:master bundle install.
What is the second step in the split workflow for Ruby 1.8?

Run cdxgen using ruby25 image:docker run --rm -e CDXGEN_DEBUG_MODE=debug -e CDXGEN_GEM_HOME=/tmp/gems -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -t ghcr.io/cyclonedx/cdxgen-ruby25:v11 -r /app -o /app/bom.json -t ruby --lifecycle pre-build. Note: --deep mode is currently not supported for Ruby 1.8.
What is the work around when .Net restore crashes on MacOS M series machine

A workaround could be to perform the dotnet restore using the official image, before using cdxgen-dotnet images. docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -w /app -it mcr.microsoft.com/dotnet/sdk:8.0 dotnet restore.
I'm getting nuget crashes on .Net Framework applications, what should I do?

To troubleshoot, try running the nuget restore command manually using the bci-dotnet image as shown. docker run --rm -v /tmp:/tmp -v $(pwd):/app:rw -w /app -it ghcr.io/cyclonedx/bci-dotnet:master nuget restore -Verbosity detailed /app/<solution file name>.
I need information about System. dependencies, where do I find them?
Use the command gacutil -l to obtain the version details for libraries from GAC.
How can I test arm64 from x64 machines?
Install Rancher Desktop and setup nerdctl instead of docker. Setup multi-platform by following this doc.
What additional flag do I need to pass when testing arm64 with Rancher Desktop and nerdctl?
Include the --platform=linux/arm64 argument with the nerdctl run command.
